episode.title: Atlas Roofing Company, Inc. v. Occupational Safety and Health Commission

section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice Byron R. White

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: The judgments and opinion of the Court in 75-746, Atlas Roofing against Occupational Safety and Health Review Board and the related case of 75-748, along with an unrelated case 75-1753 Santa Fe Industries against Green will each be announced by Mr. Justice White.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: In the Atlas Roofing and Frank Irey cases, two Courts of Appeals decided that the Federal Occupational Safety and Health Act could be enforced by the administrative in position of civil crimes subject to judicial review, but at no stage subject to the intervention of a jury.
We affirm that those judgments, we owe to that to the Seventh Amendment which generally provides for jury trials and civil cases are not applicable to statutory enforcement proceedings.
Mr. Justice Blackmun took no part in the decision of these cases.
